@JNHanvey Not sure how you can reach that interpretation. Just passing on some of what he said.
@JNHanvey Not sure why you would think that.
@JohnTudor1 @Lordmchaggis You're right - nobody interested.
@Jab64000 @whitealan2000 @WingsScotland Reporter speaks to cabinet minister, prints what he says. Straightforward. #howjournalismworks
@AngusMacNeilSNP My timeline doesn't seem to think so....
@ailsatomany Interestingly enough, respect is the word the cabinet minister uses re @NicolaSturgeon - and not in a flattering way.

Happy New Year to all our readers. @BraidenHT and others in the office today working on tomorrow's paper.
@CllrSMcCabe @sl074t @strathearnrose @scottishlabour Simply not the case.
@CllrSMcCabe Yes, from different source and which is referred to in today's story.
@CllrSMcCabe Don't think so. New internal polling obtained by @BraidenHT is basis of story. Other papers would have gone big on this too.
@CllrSMcCabe Because, as it says, Glasgow is a symbolic prize. Demise of Scottish Labour a significant story.
@CllrSMcCabe Story about wider malaise across the country. Glasgow not even mentioned until 6th paragraph.
@Scotsfox @DickWinchester Maybe they trust their representatives to represent their views.
@Eddiek62 @Lord_Nicol Siren voice? Really?
@Scotsfox @DickWinchester He speaks for the BMA in Scotland.
@Scotsfox @DickWinchester He's speaking on behalf of BMA as far as I'm aware.
@DickWinchester You had a positive experience. Maybe others don't.
@DickWinchester Just reporting BMA concerns Dick.
@Eddiek62 Reporting BMA concerns. How is that unbalanced?
@IndyLassie And a Happy Christmas to you.
Happy Christmas to all our readers. We have staff in the office today working on your Boxing Day Herald. #dedication #buyapaper
